content.content: Just to keep up to date lets put a list of rings, their purposes and people behind. Please provide ideas, edits and feedback to this. Thanks! Wallet Developers – improve UX, interoperability by @ligi SecurEth – improve smart contract and dapp security by discourse.secureth.org Signaling Ring – research and identify relevant signals, develop resources to consolidate signals and news in a trusted community forum, develop EIP(s) to integrate signaling with the technical governance process + Core Devs decision making. We’re chatting on Riot at the moment: #ethsignaling:matrix.org @GriffGreen @phillux @MaxSemenchuk https://riot.im/app/#/room/#ethsignaling:matrix.org Fund Recovery Ring – research and develop technical frameworks for the recovery of stuck funds in cases where the “‘rightful owner’ of the assets is obvious and mathematically provable, and no user is being deprived of any assets” (EIPs 156, 999, 867/ERPs) @5chdn
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on a directory of rings, which are groups focused on improving various aspects of Ethereum. The post includes a list of rings and their purposes, and the author is requesting ideas, edits, and feedback. A third party is extending to the proposal by providing constructive criticism and asking questions.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: SecurEth - improve smart contract and dapp security discourse.secureth.org

Looking forward to forging these Rings together! Signaling Ring - research and identify relevant signals, develop resources to consolidate signals and news in a trusted community forum, develop EIP(s) to integrate signaling with the technical governance process + Core Devs decision making. We’re chatting on Riot at the moment: #ethsignaling:matrix.org @GriffGreen @phillux @MaxSemenchuk Fund Recovery Ring - research and develop technical frameworks for the recovery of stuck funds in cases where the “‘rightful owner’ of the assets is obvious and mathematically provable, and no user is being deprived of any assets” (EIPs 156, 999, 867/ERPs) @5chdn EDIT/Clarification: The signaling conversation that has lead to the site build and this pending Signaling Ring emerged at EIP0 Summit and continued at FEM Berlin, more recently in regard to how a Shasper EIP could go. The technical FEM group noted that even if non-binding signals were to be a part core dev conversations, they should be clarified and EIP’d.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Added the rings mentioned here in the github wiki now: https://github.com/ethereum-magicians/scrolls/wiki

pmauric:  develop EIP(s) to integrate signaling with the technical governance process + Core Devs decision making.   Doesn’t this kind of defeat the purpose that is the difficulty of ethereums governance, if we know suddenly bind all the non-binding signals we have?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
